description: Within the CIViC database, the disease should be the cancer or cancer subtype that is a result of the described variant. The disease selected should be as specific as possible should reflect the disease type used in the source that supports the evidence statement.
name: CIViC Disease

resources.description: CIViC is an open access, open source, community-driven web resource for Clinical Interpretation of Variants in Cancer.https://civicdb.org/

institution.description: Washington University in St. Louis is a place where people matter and serious work is done. Our mission is to discover and disseminate knowledge, and to protect the freedom of inquiry through research, teaching and learning.
institution.name: Washington University in St. Louis

resources.name: Clinical Interpretation of Variants in Cancer (CIViC)
